page.title: 04Farming (Part3)
page.content: {cont. they are sold for beef.Tir-y-berth farm is a smaller unit of just 75 acres,this includes rented ground.the farm has been in the same family for over a 100 years.It has no intensive system but has 20 cows of cross bred breed,with 13 calves running at foot.The calves are reared to 12 to 15 months and then sold as store cattle in the Autumn.The cattle are fed during the winter time on hay,which is produced on 25 acres of the farm.Many large barns have recently been erected but the stone cow shed,small calves shed and tool shed are part of the original farm buildings and adjoin the farm house.The farm itself has been modernised.Ten years ago it had no electricity and relied upon well water for domestic and animal consumption. The farm has 4 horses for recreation.
